I was hoping for a deeper dive into the new abilities and how Link interacts with the world. It just felt like a tease more than a reveal. Maybe I’m expecting too much?

I'm primarily going to be using it for typing and light gaming. I'd like to keep the budget under $100 if possible. Any recommendations for beginner-friendly mechanical keyboards?

title: New Build - Boot Loops with Error Code 0xc00000e2
self_text: Hey everyone, first time builder here. I just finished building my PC and I'm stuck in a boot loop with the error code 0xc00000e2. I've triple checked all connections, reseated the RAM, and ensured the boot drive is selected in the BIOS. Still no luck. Specs below:  CPU: Ryzen 5 7600X Motherboard: MSI PRO B650M-A WIFI RAM: Corsair Vengeance 32GB (2x16GB) DDR5 5600MHz GPU: RTX 3060 Storage: Crucial P3 Plus 1TB NVMe SSD PSU: Corsair RM750x (2021)  Anyone encounter this before and have any troubleshooting tips?

title: New job - IT Support, any tips?
self_text: Starting my first official IT Support role on Monday! Mostly helpdesk stuff, Tier 1 troubleshooting, remote assistance, etc. Any veteran sysadmins or support techs have advice for a newbie? Anything I should brush up on over the weekend? Any common pitfalls to avoid?

title: Why is my cat suddenly terrified of cucumbers?
self_text: My cat, Luna, has *always* been chill. Like, totally unfazed by most things. But yesterday, I jokingly placed a cucumber near her while she was eating, and she LEAPT about three feet in the air and bolted. Now she's avoiding that entire corner of the room. It's hilarious, but also concerning. Why do cats react this way to cucumbers?!

title: Anyone else find it difficult to detach from social media?
self_text: I’ve been trying to reduce my social media usage for a while now, but I consistently find myself falling back into old habits. I delete the apps, then reinstall them within a few days. I block websites, then unblock them. It feels like an addiction, and I’m frustrated with my lack of willpower. Does anyone else struggle with this, and if so, what strategies have worked for you?

self_text: Okay, this is weird. I bought a new car a couple of weeks ago, and I LOVE the smell. But now, even after washing them, some of my clothes smell faintly like the new car scent. Like, even clothes I *didn't* wear in the car. Anyone else experience this? Is it static cling picking up particles? Am I losing my mind?

title: How is every one doing today?
self_text: Feel free to comment how you’re doing today. God bless you if you’re reading this. Each day for me is a struggle, is a battle , and I find hope in myself. I want to spread the gospel, help people with feelings of depression and suicide, help people who have had legal issues turn their life around. As many know from my previous posts, I struggle with depression , mostly because of the loss of the love of my life earlier this year. I’ve came across some very compassionate and supportive people .

Any insights or recommendations?

title: What's the biggest misconception people have about owning a cat?
self_text: That they're low maintenance! People think cats are independent and require minimal attention, but that's not always true. Many cats crave interaction, playtime, and affection. They need enrichment, regular vet visits, litter box cleaning, and can develop behavioral problems if neglected. It's a commitment, just like any other pet!

I've tried various fixes like limiting the refresh rate, disabling VSync, and ensuring I'm connected to a stable 5GHz WiFi network, but nothing seems to improve things significantly. I'm wondering if anyone else is encountering this issue and if they've found any solutions.

title: What’s the biggest misconception people have about cats?
self_text: That they're aloof and independent and don't need affection. Sure, they’re not *always* in your face like dogs, but most cats crave attention and bonding with their humans. They just show it in more subtle ways – purring, kneading, slow blinks, rubbing against you. It’s easy to misinterpret that as indifference when really they’re just showing affection in their own feline style.

title: Is anyone else getting bombarded with emails from Sephora?
self_text: Seriously, like 10 emails a day. I opted out of marketing emails, but they still come. It's ridiculous. Anyone else dealing with this and find a solution?

title: New Build - Random Shutdowns - Help!
self_text: Hi everyone, I just finished building my first PC and I'm running into random shutdowns. It happens under load (gaming) but sometimes even while browsing. No error messages, just instantly powers off. Specs are: CPU: Ryzen 7 7700X Motherboard: ASUS ROG Strix B650E-F Gaming WiFi GPU: RTX 3080 RAM: 32GB DDR5 5600MHz PSU: Corsair RM850x (fully modular) Storage: 2TB NVMe SSD I've checked all connections, reseated components, and updated BIOS. Temperatures seem okay (CPU peaks around 80°C, GPU around 70°C). Thinking it might be the PSU, but not sure. Any ideas?

title: New PC Build - Boot Issues with Ryzen 5 7600X
self_text:
Hello, I just finished building my first PC and I'm running into some boot issues. The system powers on, fans spin, lights illuminate, but nothing displays on the monitor. No POST beep either. Here are my specs: 

* CPU: Ryzen 5 7600X
* Motherboard: MSI PRO B650M-A WIFI
* RAM: Corsair Vengeance 32GB (2x16GB) DDR5 5600MHz
* GPU: RTX 3070
* PSU: Corsair RM750x
* SSD: Crucial P5 Plus 1TB

I've triple-checked all connections, reseated the RAM and CPU cooler, and cleared the CMOS. Still no luck. Any suggestions on what to troubleshoot next? Is it potentially a BIOS issue?

title: Why do I get constant disconnects when gaming?
self_text: Hello, I built my girlfriend a PC about a year ago, and I've just recently found out that since it was built, the display tends to cut out every hour or so. Issue The display will turn black as if the cable was disconnected. The monitor will receive no signal for about 2-3 seconds and then it kicks back in. Specs Gigabyte RTX 3060 AMD Ryzen 5 3600 Corsair Vengeance RGB DDR4 (2*8gb) MSI B550 Tomahawk Max +WiFi Corsair RM 750W PSU Asus ROG 1080p@144hz Display Windows 10 Home Attempted Solutions I have tried the display on a separate PC and the issue does not occur. I have updated the video drivers to the latest version, including a clean install. I am going to poke around in the BIOS to see if there's any settings there that might be the issue.

title: What’s the biggest lie you’ve ever told?
self_text: Okay, buckle up. Back in high school, I told my crush I was fluent in French. Like, conversational, read-French-literature fluent. The truth? I took two semesters in high school and remembered how to say “Bonjour” and order a croissant. We ended up going on a date, and he casually started speaking to me *entirely* in French. I panicked and pretended to have a sudden migraine. The date ended abruptly, and I never saw him again. Still cringe thinking about it.

title: New Build - Random Shutdowns - Help!
self_text:
Hey everyone, first time building a PC and I'm running into some frustrating issues. My PC will randomly shut down, sometimes during gaming, sometimes while browsing the web. No BSOD, just instant shutdown. 

Here are my specs:

* CPU: Ryzen 5 7600X
* Motherboard: MSI PRO B650M-A WIFI
* RAM: Corsair Vengeance 32GB (2x16GB) DDR5 5600MHz
* GPU: RTX 3070
* PSU: Corsair RM750x (750W)
* Storage: WD Black SN850X 1TB NVMe SSD

I've already checked the PSU connections, reseated the RAM, and updated the BIOS. Temperatures seem okay (CPU peaks around 75°C under load, GPU around 65°C). I suspect it might be the PSU, but I'm not sure.

Any ideas on what could be causing this?

title: What's the biggest misconception about owning a cat?
self_text: That they're low maintenance! People think cats are independent and require minimal effort, but that's not always true. They need playtime, enrichment, regular vet visits, litter box cleaning, and lots of attention (even if they don't *always* show it!). A bored or neglected cat can quickly develop behavioral problems.

title: Is it okay to switch from iPhone to Android?
self_text: I've been an iPhone user for years, but I'm starting to feel restricted by the ecosystem. I'm curious about Android phones, especially the customization options and open-source nature. Is switching worth it? Are there major downsides I should be aware of, like app compatibility or data transfer issues?

title: Is it okay to use multiple accounts to access streaming services?
self_text: My family uses a single Netflix account, but we all have different profiles. Is this technically violating their terms of service? I know some services restrict usage to a single household. Just curious if anyone knows the specifics for major platforms like Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, etc.

title: Is it okay to use a USB hub with my PS5?
self_text: I want to connect more than the allotted amount of controllers to my PS5, and I was wondering if using a powered USB hub would be a viable solution. I've heard mixed reviews online, with some people saying it works perfectly fine and others reporting compatibility issues. Has anyone had success using a USB hub with their PS5, and if so, what brand/model would you recommend?

title: Why does my cat stare at walls?
self_text: My cat will sometimes just sit and intensely stare at a wall for like 10-20 minutes. No shadows, no bugs, just… the wall. Is this normal cat behavior? Is she seeing something I'm not? Should I be concerned?

title: Does anyone else find the smell of rain oddly comforting?
self_text: It’s weird, I know, but whenever it rains, there’s this specific smell that just calms me down. Petrichor, I think it’s called? Anyone else feel that way?

title: New car smell and headaches
self_text: I recently purchased a new vehicle and every time I drive it, I get a headache. I’ve researched online and it appears to be a common phenomenon known as “new car smell,” which is actually volatile organic compounds (VOCs) off-gassing. Has anyone else experienced this? Any recommendations for mitigating the issue aside from keeping the windows open? Air purifier perhaps?

title: Does anyone else find the new Zelda trailer underwhelming?
self_text: I know it's probably harsh to say, but after the massive hype surrounding Breath of the Wild, and the long wait, the reveal trailer for Tears of the Kingdom felt… lacking. It showed snippets of gameplay, but didn't really establish a compelling narrative hook or showcase truly groundbreaking features. It felt more like an expansion announcement than a full-fledged sequel reveal. Am I alone in feeling this way?

title: Is the Steam Deck worth it if you already have a Switch?
self_text: I already own a Nintendo Switch and love it, but I've been eyeing the Steam Deck for a while now. I primarily play indie games and RPGs on my Switch. Would the Steam Deck offer enough of a different experience to justify the purchase, or would it essentially be redundant? I'm not super concerned about playing AAA titles on it, but the larger library and potential for emulation are appealing.

title: New Monitor - Ghosting/Blur Issues?
self_text: Recently purchased an LG 27GN850-B and noticing ghosting/blurring in fast paced games (CS:GO primarily). Overclocking doesn't seem to alleviate the issue. Tried various settings, refresh rate capped at 144Hz, response time set to fastest, etc. Is this a known issue with this model, or could it be something on my end? Specs: RTX 3070, Ryzen 5 5600X.

title: Anyone else experiencing weird lag spikes in Warzone?
self_text: Lately, I've been getting random, split-second lag spikes in Warzone, even with a stable internet connection. It's not packet loss, ping stays consistent, and it happens regardless of server location. Seems to affect a lot of players, but haven't seen much official acknowledgement. Anyone else dealing with this? Specs below: Ryzen 5 5600x RTX 3070 32GB RAM

title: Is it okay to use a USB hub with a mechanical keyboard?
self_text: I have a Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 keyboard and my PC only has a few USB ports available. I was thinking of purchasing a powered USB hub to plug the keyboard into, along with some other peripherals. Would this negatively impact the keyboard's performance or polling rate? I've heard mixed opinions online.

title: Is it okay to ask a female coworker out on a date?
self_text: I work with a woman who I think is really cute and fun to be around. We have a lot in common and I enjoy talking to her. I'm wondering if it's appropriate to ask her out on a date, or if that could create awkwardness at work. I don't want to jeopardize our working relationship. Any advice?

title: I'm having trouble understanding the difference between static and dynamic IPs
self_text: I'm trying to set up port forwarding on my router, and I keep seeing references to static and dynamic IPs. I understand *that* I need a static IP for it to work reliably, but I don't understand *why*. What's the difference between the two, and why does port forwarding require a static IP address?

title: Anyone else getting constant "Low Disk Space" warnings on Pixel 7 Pro?
self_text: Despite having 128GB of storage with ~40GB free, my Pixel 7 Pro keeps popping up notifications saying my storage is low. Clearing cache and deleting files temporarily fixes it, but it returns within a day. Seems like a software bug? Anyone else experiencing this?

title: Newbie question about ethernet cables
self_text: Hi everyone, building my first PC and trying to wrap my head around all the components. I've seen different categories of ethernet cables (Cat5e, Cat6, Cat6a, etc.). What's the biggest difference between them and which one should I get for a stable internet connection with speeds up to 1Gbps? I don't think I'll be needing anything faster anytime soon.

title: Is it okay to ask a potential employer for salary range upfront?
self_text: I have an interview scheduled next week for a position I'm really excited about. I'm a little hesitant to bring up salary expectations early in the process, but I'm also wary of wasting my time (and theirs) if we're wildly misaligned on compensation. Is it acceptable to politely inquire about the salary range for the role *before* the interview, or should I wait until they bring it up? I don't want to come across as pushy or entitled.

title: Does anyone else have trouble sleeping after watching Love is Blind?
self_text: Seriously, I finished season 5 last night and tossed and turned for HOURS replaying scenarios and analyzing everyone’s choices. It's like my brain refuses to shut off! Anyone else experience this?

title: Is it okay to use a USB-C to USB-A adapter with a PS5 controller?
self_text: I've been using a USB-C to USB-A adapter with my PS5 controller to connect it to my PC for a while now, and it's been working perfectly fine. However, I've seen some people online saying that it can cause charging issues or interfere with the controller's functionality. Is this true? Should I switch to a dedicated USB-A to USB-A cable instead?

title: What is the best way to approach learning Python?
self_text: I'm a complete beginner to programming and want to learn Python. There are *so* many resources online (Codecademy, Udemy courses, books, documentation, etc.) that I'm paralyzed by choice. What's the most effective way to learn, balancing practical application with understanding the fundamentals? Should I focus on projects right away, or build a solid base first? Any recommendations for specific resources geared towards absolute beginners?

title: Is there a way to disable the automatic brightness adjustment on my Pixel 7?
self_text: My Pixel 7 keeps automatically adjusting the screen brightness, even with adaptive brightness turned off. It's incredibly annoying, especially in dimly lit rooms. I've searched online but haven't found a solution that works. Anyone else experiencing this and found a fix?

title: Is it weird to miss a stranger?
self_text: I was at a coffee shop yesterday and struck up a conversation with a woman while waiting in line. We chatted for maybe 10-15 minutes about books and travel, and it was just a really pleasant interaction. I haven't thought about her since, but then I realized I was actively *missing* having that little chat. Like, I wish I'd asked for her number or social media. Is that weird? It wasn't romantic or anything, just a genuine connection with someone for a fleeting moment.

title: Does anyone else get frustrated with the amount of filler episodes in anime?
self_text: Like, I get needing breathing room for characters and worldbuilding, but sometimes it feels like half a season is just characters doing mundane things that don’t contribute to the main plot. It pulls me out of the story and makes it hard to stay invested.

title: Is it weird to miss someone you barely knew?
self_text: Okay, so this is kinda embarrassing. I worked with this guy for like, two weeks during a busy season at a retail job. We didn’t really *talk* talk, just casual work chat, but he was always really nice and made me laugh. Then he just…stopped showing up. No announcement, no goodbye, just gone. And I’m oddly bummed out about it. It’s silly because I barely knew him, but I miss having that friendly face around. Is this normal?
